title: Spring forces - 4 kg block and springs in series

content.question: A group of students is experimenting with two springs, Spring <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Spring <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Spring <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> stretches by a distance of <math alttext="0.400 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.400</mn><mtext> m</mtext></math> when a block weighing <math alttext="8.0 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8.0</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> is hung vertically from it. When the same block is hung vertically from Spring <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, Spring <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> stretches by a distance of <math alttext="0.100 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.100</mn><mtext> m</mtext></math>. The two springs are then connected in series, and a smaller <math alttext="4.0 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> block is hung vertically from this combination of springs. What is the distance that this combination will stretch from its unstretched length?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
